contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|MLK}} '''MLK''' commonly refers to '''[[Martin Luther King, Jr.]]''' (1929–1968), American clergyman, activist, and prominent leader in the African American civil rights movement '''MLK''' or '''mlk''' may also refer to: *[[Marxist–Leninist Struggle League for the Communist Party of Sweden (M–L)]], defunct Swedish communist organization *[[Moloch]] (written "mlk" מלך in unvowelled Hebrew), ancient Semitic god ==Music== *[[MLK (song)|"MLK" (song)]], from the 1984 U2 album ''The Unforgettable Fire'' *''[[Misery Loves Kompany]]'', Tech N9ne album ==Stations== *[[MLK, Jr. (Capital MetroRail station)]], in Austin, Texas, USA *[[MLK, Jr. (DART station)]], in Dallas, Texas, USA *MLK, [[List of Amtrak station codes#M|Amtrak station code]] for Moses Lake, Washington, USA *MLK, station code for [[Mooroolbark railway station]], Melbourne, Victoria, Australia ==See also== *[[Martin Luther King (disambiguation)]] *[[List of streets named after Martin Luther King, Jr.]] {{Disambig}}
